result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Frederick Deon Parham III

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Frederick Deon Parham III appeared by video.  Attorney Mindy M. Nolan appeared by video for Frederick Deon Parham III.  Attorney Tristan Bednarek appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
DPA hearing held. Court held colloquy with the defendant regarding his right to have an in-person hearing. Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 29.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights, filed.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, filed.

Defendant Frederick Deon Parham III appeared by video.  Attorney Mindy M. Nolan appeared by video for Frederick Deon Parham III.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing. Defense counsel requests an adjournment, due to reasons put forth on the record. Case adjourned to Br 29.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Email correspondence with parties. Court is in trial on another matter and unable to hear case. Case scheduled for a Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing on 08/29/2022 at 02:00 PM, Br 29.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Violent Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AJP except in writing or at court ordered mediation.

Defendant Frederick Deon Parham in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 29.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Men Ending Violence Program Verification, filed.
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 065108,
Payable Number: 1019275,
Receipt Number: 22RP028119,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/13/22 @ 1p
